title.narrative: Guaranteeing livelihoods: producing health, growing lives in the coastal zone of Paraíba

description.narrative:
Many poor rural families today are struggling to create a viable livelihood from farming. A number of factors put at risk the continued survival of rural communities, particularly for those who have recently secured land title, as well as the very concept of viable agroecological production. These challenges have intensified since the Pandemic with new economic pressures. Climate change related drought and water scarcity has increased difficulties. To address these issues, this project will improve the quality, quantity, and resilience of small farmers' agroecological production, through investment in production and strengthening of the Agroecology Network. Combined, these efforts will help to secure access to healthy, nutritious food and improve income for rural communities, greater resilience to climate change and ensuring that agroecological farming is viable. As a consequence, this project will contribute to enabling the viability of small farming families' livelihoods, avoiding out-migration to urban and peri-urban areas, improving food security and food sovereignty , valuing of sociobiodiversity, reducing rural poverty and preventing poor rural families’ socioeconomic situation from worsening.
The project will contribute to reducing poverty, improving livelihoods and quality of life for 60 families in Phase 1 and 168 families in Phase 2. These farming families currently participate in seven agroecological fairs, one agroecological grocery store in the Archdiocese of Paraíba and an online fair. The project will also reach approximately 5,000 people who buy produce in these spaces as 12000 people who will benefit from donations of emergency fresh food via public procurement contract. This will be achieved through actions to strengthen the production and commercialisation of agroecological food production, and through the consolidation of the Agroecology Network which the project beneficiaries participate in.
